Project Description: The proposed project will create a mobile working environment that privileges land-based research-creation and Indigenous knowledges, connected to experiences from Black, Indigenous and People of Colour communities to create work crucial to an understanding of relational demographics.
Lead Research Institution: Ontario College of Art and Design University

Project Title: Cerebrovascular Hemodynamics in Health and Disease
Project Description: The requested infrastructure will establish a laboratory at McMaster University that studies important connections between the cardiovascular and cerebrovascular systems, how exercise paradigms impacts risk of diseases related to brain blood vessels, and how to improve utility of imaging tools.

Project Title: Environmentally controlled growth system and molecular phenotyping platform for plant immunity research
Project Description: My research will identify and characterize important genes regulating the plant salicylic acid pathway at elevated temperature through mutational, gene expression, and inter-species analyses at different temperatures. This would unravel the significant impact of temperature on plant immunity and disease.

Project Title: LC-TOF MC for Enhanced Chemical Containment Risk Characterization
Project Description: A standalone liquid chromatography time-of-flight mass spectrometry (LC-TOF-MS) system is requested for the development of a state-of-the-art metabolomics platform to study pollution in Ontario water.

Project Title: Sensory-Cognitive Listening Assessment to Transform Hearing Loss Outcomes
Project Description: Older people with hearing loss often disengage from listening, which puts them at risk for social withdrawal. We will integrate different levels of inquiry – from neural function to listening experiences in social situations – to create metrics that capture disengagement before it manifests as social withdrawal.

Project Title: Optical Imaging in the Pre-Clinical Setting
Project Description: This proposal examines how bacterial pathogens resist host defenses, which we use as an entry point to drug discovery where the goal of therapy is to re-sensitize bacteria to the action of host immunity. Drug-resistant infections and Crohn’s disease are the focus, which are both urgent problems in Ontario.

Project Title: Decision Making Laboratory.
Project Description: The Decision Making Laboratory at the Ivey Business School will facilitate studies of the decision-making experience in multiple contexts using triangulated quantitative and qualitative measures.

Project Title: Membrane Remodelling by Positive-Sense RNA Viruses: Molecular Mechanisms and Cellular Responses.
Project Description: Emerging viral infections are a major public health threat and are currently untreatable. Our objective is to identify novel antiviral strategies against emerging viruses in the positive-sense RNA virus group. We characterize how these viruses exploit cellular factors to replicate within their target cells.

Project Title: The Trent Social Relations, Attitudes and Diversity Lab.
Project Description: Researchers will harness cutting-edge technology to study complex human behaviours and interactions, including love, affection, prejudice and violence. Specifically, research on persistent violence directed at the LGBTQ community as well as predictors of well-being in same-sex relationships will be conducted.

Project Title: Immersive Interaction and Morphological Control for Continuum Robot Systems.
Project Description: This project investigates continuum robots, operated or monitored by a human through an immersive interface. These worm-like robots will reach the unreachable in a non-destructive, minimally invasive manner, and perform operations and manipulate objects with unprecedented accuracy and dexterity.

Project Title: Psychosis Research Lab: Assessment of Biological, Psychological, and Behavioural Factors Associated with Psychosis.
Project Description: The Psychosis Research Lab will use multi-method assessment to develop novel therapeutic approaches to treat schizophrenia-spectrum disorders. Based on cognitive-behavioural and cognitive remediation therapies, these approaches will improve recovery from psychosis.

Project Title: Dynamic Nanoimaging of DNA Damage and Repair in Neurodegenerative Diseases.
Project Description: The goal of the research team is to develop dynamic nanoscale imaging-based technologies to explore dynamic DNA repair from oxidative stress damage in real time, leading to refinement of new drug leads and biomarker development for age-onset neurodegenerative diseases.

Project Title: Physics-Based Visual Computing Infrastructure
Project Description: This project will develop new methodologies and computational tools to synthesize imagery and animations based on the physics of light and materials. The resulting methods will enable the efficient creation of realistic virtual environments, which is increasingly vital to many digital media applications.

Project Title: Robotics Infrastructre for Smart Manufacturing (RISM)
Project Description: The Robotics Infrastructure for Smart Manufacturing initiative will establish a unique state-of-the-art R&D program to address the open challenges of incorporating intelligent robotics into material handling, part metrology and manufacturing, and quality control onto Ontario’s factory floors.

Project Title: Ecological Evolutionary Development Genetics: Flies and Ants as Model and Supermodel Organisms
Project Description: The objective of this project is to identify evolutionarily conserved molecular signals mediating interorgan communication. This project seeks to establish ants as a model system for interrogating the influence of the environment on complex physiological processes related to development and reproduction.

Project Title: Interactive Animal Fight and Dynamic Behaviour Laboratory
Project Description: The goal of the Dynamic Behaviour Lab is to discover how flying animals use visual information to navigate safely and avoid collisions in complex environments. Knowledge of the rules that govern animal flight can inspire new automated technologies and inform wildlife management.

Project Title: From Dish to Fish: Supporting Farmed Fish Health in Canada
Project Description: Using a novel nanoparticle as a carrier for nutritional supplements and innate immune stimulants, we aim to translate the findings we have made in the ‘dish’, our cell line-based work, to the ‘fish’, rainbow trout. Fish health and immune parameters will be measured. This project will support farmed fish health.

Project Title: A dynamic force and motion simulator for characterizing spine biomechanics under complex loading
Project Description: The objective of this research is to advance understanding of the spine’s response and tolerance to complex loading to enhance models for injury prevention and treatment. New infrastructure will enable experiments to quantify the effect of loading conditions associated with aging, injury and surgical repair.

Project Title: Real-time Traffic Monitoring System for Studying Traffic at Canada's Busiest Land Border Crossing
Project Description:
1. Real-time monitoring and prediction of border traffic at Canada’s busiest border crossing, 
2. Development of a commercial application for short-term prediction of border crossing times, and 
3. Micro-simulation model calibration to analyze car-truck interaction in a complex and congested corridor

Project Title: A Hardware-in-the-loop test facility for space robotics
Project Description: A robot manipulator system is requested to set up a cutting-edge 3-dimensional hardware-in-the-loop test facility for validation and verification of intelligent autonomy technologies for space robotic systems that kinematically emulates an outer space orbital environment in a laboratory.

Project Title: Research Center to Study Cancer with Single Cell Resolution
Project Description: This infrastructure will allow Dr. Postovit and her collaborators to discover new targets and biomarkers for cancer. The team will harness the equipment to study gene expression and behaviour, one cell at a time, so that the diversity of cancer cells can be targeted and therapy resistance prevented.

Project Title: Security Evaluation and Synthesis for Smart Devices
Project Description: This research proposes original security frameworks for vulnerability detection and security hardening of smart systems and technologies. The research output can be of great benefit to smart device vendors in Ontario in detecting and defending against cyber and physical vulnerabilities in smart devices.

Project Title: AI-Enhanced Mobility Lab
Project Description: The research will establish an AI-enhanced mobility lab to efficiently predict and manage road traffic and individual vehicle behavior with connected and autonomous vehicles. The project will develop an AI platform for data collection, traffic prediction and control, in order to improve urban mobility.

Project Title: Integrated Device-Driven Approaches for Automated, Real-Time Tracking
Project Description: A two-part biosensor device will be developed that will detect presence of disease biomarkers in patient blood and simultaneously deliver the right dose of the appropriate drug. This single miniature device will enable continuous monitoring and treatment, which has not been possible to date.

Project Title: Integrated Soil Sensing and Mapping for Optimized Management of Land Resources
Project Description: The proposed infrastructure aims to develop a novel, innovative, unique, and state-of-the-art mobile research unit for detailed characterization of soil properties and quantification of soil spatial variability through optimized sampling and digital soil mapping in high resolution and in three dimensions.

Project Title: In-Depth 2D and Whole Tissue 3D Detection of Tissue Fibro-Inflammation in Metabolic Diseases
Project Description: Our aim is to understand molecular events underlying obesity-induced metabolic diseases, in order to develop innovative and tangible therapeutic strategies. We will use the state-of-the-art Light Sheet Microscope and Live Cell and Tissue Imaging System to examine fibro-inflammation of fat and brain.

Project Title: Linking Neural and Vascular Aging in the Brain: From Biophysics to Cognition
Project Description: This project centres on improving our understanding of the connection between brain function and vascular hemodynamics in aging, from a biophysical to a network-based and eventually to a cognitive perspective.  It will be accomplished with the help of concurrent functional magnetic resonance imaging and electroencephalography.

Project Title: Characterization of immunological mechanisms underlying evasion of checkpoint blockade in non-small cell lung cancer
Project Description: Immunotherapy aims to “turn on” the anticancer immune response, but most patients do not respond. I study immune responses in tumour tissues, comparing “cellular maps” from tumours that do and do not respond to immunotherapy, to predict which drug(s) will be most effective for a given patient.

Project Title: Flux Measurements of Atmospheric Nitrous Acid (HONO) by Time-of-Flight Chemical Ionisation Mass Spectrometry (ToFCIMS)
Project Description: Processes controlling reactive nitrogen exchanged across the Earth-atmosphere interface will be determined using a state-of-the-science atmospherically interfaced time-of-flight mass spectrometer. Flux measurements, as well as experimental chambers, will help to understand the nitrogen cycle better.

Project Title: Visualizing soft surfaces using scanning probe microscopy
Project Description: We will develop a new imaging technique by creating novel labeling materials for scanning probe microscopy to study bacterial cell surfaces at enhanced resolution. The knowledge revealed by these images will support further research in developing sensors for infectious diseases.

Project Title: Digital Tools for Documentation and Renewal of Global Endangered Languages
Project Description: The Endangered Language Knowledge Sharing and Research Centre will be the first community-based facility in Ontario to facilitate, adapt and develop digital tools that enable endangered language communities in their aspirations and efforts to document and revitalize their languages.

Project Title: Individually ventilated caging systems to support animal research
Project Description: Canada’s ageing population makes research on age-related disease timely. Characterizing how aging affects the brain using animal models will help us find the earliest signs of disease, aiding the development of treatments that can help all Canadians live longer.

Project Title: Digital Non-Fiction Research Cluster
Project Description: The primary objective of this research cluster is to explore the intersection of essay films, interaction design and expanded cinema within public spaces by using a mobile presentation infrastructure, specifically one that would allow the circulation of media works, performance, and community-based research activities to different cities, communities, and public spaces.
Lead Research Institution: Ontario College of Art and Design University

Project Title: The StoryBoard Lab
Project Description: The StoryBoard Lab will conduct multi- and cross-disciplinary research into interactive digital narrative designed for large interactive surfaces environments with the goals of designing new forms of narrative and providing innovative ways to experience rich, immersive stories.

Project Title: Design and Development of Machine Learning Aided 5G & Beyond-5G Wireless Networks Using Software Defined Radio
Project Description: The objective of this proposal is to establish an advanced wireless research lab with an accompanying research program at Carleton University to enable experimental research on 5G and beyond-5G wireless technologies with a target impact on Ontario’s strong ICT and 5G wireless research ecosystem.

Project Title: Nano-Materials-Based Wearable Sensors and Electronics: Achieving Superior Performance and Visual Imperceptibility
Project Description: The goal is to address the current challenges of wearable sensor-systems for applications in mobile health care and internet of things, such as high reliability and performance, by utilizing emerging nanomaterials with extraordinary electrical, mechanical and optical properties in the structure of sensors and circuits.

Project Title: Abilities Living Lab (ALL)
Project Description: ALL is an integrated environment for co-creation, iterative prototyping, experimentation, simulation, and knowledge mobilization. The research program may lead to the development of new assistive and rehabilitation devices, public environments and facilities, and more accessible experiences.
Keyword: accessibility, design, engineering, mobility, performance, health and wellness, rehabilitation, age-friendly, inclusive sports and recreation, disability

Project Title: Development of Next Generation Liquid Argon Dark Matter Detector and of an Underground Argon Storage Facility at SNOLAB
Project Description: This project will initiate a profound shift in our understanding of Dark Matter, 26% of our Universe, with Nobel-calibre impact in physics and astronomy. Experienced Ontario scientists will create infrastructure at SNOLAB (Sudbury, ON), in Italy, and the ultimate experiment, Argo, at SNOLAB.
Keyword: Dark matter, argon, underground science, weak interaction, light sensor, low background, neutrino

Project Title: Revealing the Functional and Molecular Mechanisms of Brain Disease with Better Imaging Tools
Project Description: This project focuses on two leading-edge technologies to enhance imaging of neurologic and psychiatric disorders: a positron emission tomography insert that fits in any MRI to provide unrivaled sensitivity and a portable light-based device for brain monitoring in a variety of settings–e.g. surgery.
Keyword: Brain ageing, mental health, dementia, high-resolution low-dose positron emission tomography, hybrid imaging, optical brain imaging

Project Title: 3D Multi-scale Correlative and Time-lapsed Microscopy: A Canadian platform for materials acceleration
Project Description: The 3D-MCTM platform will provide uparalleled multi-scale 3D imaging of a material’s structure as it evolves under conditions that mimic manufacturing and service to accelerate discovery of novel materials urgently needed to meet the challenges of healthy aging and a clean energy future in Ontario.
Keyword: Materials acceleration platform; correlative microscopy, X-ray tomographic imaging, Focused ion beam electron tomography, energy materials, metallic alloys, cementitious materials, biomaterials, clean energy, healthcare

Project Title: Canadian Longitudinal Study on Aging (CLSA): A Platform for Interdisciplinary Research
Project Description: The CLSA Platform is a national infrastructure led by McMaster University, operated by highly acclaimed scientists and experts, for ongoing collection, storage and analyses of data and biological samples for population-based social and health research to understand different trajectories of aging.
Keyword: Aging, gerontology/geriatrics, epidemiology, allied and health services delivery, determinants of health, population studies, social health, metabolomics, biology of aging, mobility and aging

Project Title: Building a Future for Canadian Neutron Scattering
Project Description: This  project will provide 100 Principal Investigators, including 50 from Ontario, access to a versatile and irreplaceable tool for materials research—neutron beams—to solve science and technology-related problems  arising from the environment, information technology, manufacturing, and human health
Keyword: neutron scattering, neutron diffraction, neutron spectroscopy, materials science, condensed matter physics, materials chemistry, magnetism, soft and hydrogenous materials, structural materials, energy materials.

Project Title: Towards dynamic materials characterization with electrons and photons in extreme environments
Project Description: This proposal will enable the dynamic characterization of the structure and composition of materials as they evolve, degrade or perform during operation under temperature, pressure, cycling, cryogenic from model to realistic conditions, employing electrons, ions or photons.
Keyword: Advanced Manufacturing, Nuclear Materials Safety, Energy Storage, Renewable energy, Biomaterials production, Materials in critical infrastructure, Quantum materials

Project Title: ExCELLirate Canada: Expanding CELL-based Immunotherapy ResearchAcceleration for Translation and Evaluation
Project Description: ExCELLirate Canada requests funding for crucial infrastructure to develop a national cellular therapy translational research platform, the first of its kind globally, to support required research activities and accelerate the translation into affordable, life-saving treatments.
Keyword: cell therapy, CAR T-cells, clinical trials, point of care manufacturing, health economics, biomarker discovery

Project Title: Climate Adaptive infraStructure Testing and Longevity Evaluation (CASTLE) Innovation Cluster
Project Description: Our research vision is to establish a globally innovative infrastructure test facility with enhanced training capacity to maximize resilience to climate-related geohazards and minimize deterioration of four classes of infrastructure of critical importance to Ontario and Canada.
Keyword: dams, mine waste, pipelines, buried infrastructure, landslides, coastal defenses, climate change

Project Title: Smart Campus Integration and Testing Lab
Project Description: Buildings use 43% of Ontario’s energy and generate 22% of GHGs. The SCITLab is a purpose-built facility consisting of full-scale office and residential testbeds to develop novel technologies to reduce building energy consumption and associated emissions while improving indoor environmental quality.
Keyword: smart buildings; smart cities; energy efficiency; data science; energy optimization; smart commissioning; data visualization; fault detection; cybersecurity

Project Title: Probing the molecular state of rare cell phenotypes
Project Description: This project will build an integrated platform to identify and characterize rare cells that contribute to cancer, neurodegenerative and other disorders and develop drug leads to treat these diseases. The platform will be accessible to the scientific community to enable further rare cell studies.
Keyword: rare cell phenotyping, quantitative single cell analysis, functional microproteomics, structural biology, network biology, cell state transitions

Project Title: Human Cardiovascular Integrative Physiology Laboratory: The Challenge of Medical Complexity
Project Description: Heart disease is becoming very common and complicated. We are investing in the “Human Cardiovascular Integrative Physiology Laboratory” which is a special facility where we study how body systems work with the heart to support the whole person; because a system doesn’t get sick, the person does.
Keyword: Precision phenotyping, acute dyspnea, physiologic monitoring, heart failure,obstructive lung disease, blood pressure, hospitalization

Project Title: Artificial Intelligence Platform for Precision Medicine
Project Description: Linking hospital data and high-performance computing, the proposed high-level processing, data connectivity and image archiving will allow new AI algorithms to be trained using the medical image data generated at Sunnybrook, enabling practical 'precision medicine' in the clinic.
Keyword: personalized medicine, precision medicine, deep learning, medical imaging, digital pathology, Enterprise Artifical Intelligence (AI), Research System, Pathology, PACS, Radiology

Project Title: SPaCEMAP: Single Particle CryoEM Analysis Project
Project Description: SPaCEMAP will establish a world class cryoEM facility in Ontario. This facility will provide atomic level snapshots of biological molecules. These snapshots will advance structural biology research and guide the design and development of drugs to treat cancer, therapies for infections, and vaccines.
Keyword: Cancer, Infectious disease, Cryo-EM, protein structure, structure based drug design, novel small molecule therapeutics and biologics

Project Title: The continuum of protein interactions in health and disease
Project Description: This project will drive cutting-edge research into the protein interactions that underlie human diseases. The knowledge created will lead to the development of improved vaccines and to new treatments for drug resistant bacterial infections, cardiovascular diseases, neurological disorders and cancer.
Keyword: Biophysics, neurobiology, cancer, cardiovascular diseases, infectious diseases, phase separation, protein interactions, intrinsic disorder, biophysical tools

Project Title: SecureData4Health
Project Description: Effective interpretation and use of genome and health data relies on secure data accessibility. SecureData4Health will create the privacy, software and computational infrastructure that Ontario’s scientists need to lead the global movement towards international health data sharing.
Keyword: Bioinformatics, genomics, computational biology, data sharing, security, health informatics, machine learning, cancer, rare disease

Project Title: Advanced Fetal Diagnosis and Therapy Program
Project Description: We will use the requested infrastructure to develop new surgical tools and methods to repair fetal anomalies. This will establish Ontario’s scientific and clinical leadership in fetal surgery, and attract top-tier scientists, clinicians and venture capital in the medical technology space.
Keyword: Fetal surgery, Magnetic resonance and multi-modal imaging, In-utero diagnosis and treatment, Surgical robotics

Project Title: CGEn – A National Platform for Genome Sequencing and Analysis
Project Description: This infrastructure updates and enhances Ontario’s node of the CGEn national genome sequencing facility. This will enable transformational biomedical and life science research, laying the groundwork for translation into precision medicine, biotechnology, and other strategic value for Ontario.
Keyword: genomics, genome sequencing, precision medicine, autism, cancer, genomics infrastructure, model organisms, biodiversity, computational biology, rare diseases

Project Title: Neurochemical basis of high-level cognitive function in health and disease
Project Description: We will combine new cutting-edge technologies in mouse models of neurodegenerative disease with  touchscreen-based cognitive tests identical to those used in humans to understand brain dysfunction at the molecular and cellular level and to translate this knowledge to effective treatments.
Keyword: neurodegenerative disease, neurochemical pathways, cognitive deficits, cognitive biomarkers, imaging, mental health, mouse models, behaviour, cognition

Project Title: Functional Atomic-scale Materials Engineering (FAME)
Project Description: The infrastructure project is represented by a scanning probe microscope, designed for operation at low temperature and high magnetic fields to allow for spatially resolved magnetic imaging. This instrumentation will enable advances in understanding materials for developing innovative technologies.
Keyword: Scanning Probe Microscopy, 2D materials, graphene, Scanning Hall Probe,  Magnetism, Environmental Sensors

Project Title: Canadian Mother-Child Cohort Active Surveillance Initiative (CAMCCO)
Project Description: CAMCCO will build harmonized pregnancy/child cohorts across five Canadian provinces (QC, ON, MB, SK, AB) using routinely-collected health data. With this data infrastructure, CAMCCO will provide timely estimates of the harms and benefits of medication use during pregnancy for mothers and children.
Keyword: perinatal epidemiology, pharmacoepidemiology, routinely collected data, population cohorts, medication use, pregnancy, psychotropic medications, opiods

Project Title: Hub of Excellence for Cardio-Neuro-Mind Research (HCNMR)
Project Description: The HCNMR’s research, for which the requested infrastructure is critical, will result in improved diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of co-occurring brain-heart conditions and a transformation in the care of patients with linked cardiovascular, neurological and psychiatric conditions.
Keyword: Diagnostic biomarkers, radioprobes, models of diseases, brain-heart connection, brain-heart registry, molecular imaging

Project Title: TRANSFORMATIVE NANOPHOTONICS
Project Description: To transform capacity for fundamental and applied research of nanostructured materials including semiconductors, for advanced photonic devices, targeting applications in telecom, medicine, cybersecurity, aerospace, automotive and advanced manufacturing, for the benefit of Ontario.
Keyword: photonics, nanophotonics, optoelectronics, structured light, optical orbital angular momentum, III-V compound semiconductors, metal-organic chemical vapour deposition, nanostructure, photonic device miniaturization, semiconductor wafer processing, photonic integrated circuits

Project Title: Center for Hybrid Interfaces and Intelligent Thin-Films (HIIT)
Project Description: HIIT will accelerate the translation from materials development to prototype production by providing world-class expertise and infrastructure required to tailor and process advanced hybrid thin films and will be instrumental in filling the skilled-worker gap in relevant job sectors in Ontario.
Keyword: Intelligent Thin Films; Hybrid Thin Films; Tailored Interfaces; Multifunctional thinfilm structures; Smart Textile; Organic-Inorganic Printed Films; Multiaxes Aeorsal; SAXS; Tilt-Enabled Deposition; ICP-PECVD; DRIE-ICP

Project Title: A Multi-Hazards Simulator (MHS) for Sustainable and Resilient Infrastructure
Project Description: The uOttawa Multi Hazard Simulator for Sustainable and Resilient Infrastructure will be the world’s only experimental research facility with a multi-hazards wave-current-sediment-earthquake flume and innovative sensors for coastal and inland-water disaster prevention and mitigation research.
Keyword: Natural Disasters, Storms, Floods, Earthquakes, Resilient Design, Optics, Pollution Discharge, Climate Change, Sensors, Design Standards and Guidelines

Project Title: Multidisciplinary Observatory for Arctic Climate Change and Extreme Events Monitoring (MOACC)
Project Description: This project will install permanent multidisciplinary scientific infrastructure at the Canadian High Arctic Research Station in Cambridge Bay to enable long-term observations of the atmosphere, snow, hydrology, and permafrost for investigating the key drivers and impacts of Arctic climate change.
Keyword: atmosphere, hydrology, snow, permafrost, remote sensing, modeling, ecological applications, climate, weather, aerosols

Project Title: An Integrated Platform for the Analysis of Brain Inflammation
Project Description: The TOronto Neuro-Immunology/Imaging Consortium (TONIIC) requests infrastructure to support transdisciplinary brain research at multiple scales (structure, tissue, cells and genes), thus facilitating transformative advances in the understanding and treatment of neurological and mental disorders.
Keyword: Neuroinflammation, Immunology, Inflammation, Immune Cells, Neurodegenerative Diseases, Mental Health, Brain / CNS Imaging, Molecular Biology, Physics, Magnetic Resonance Imaging

Project Title: Canadian Hydrogen Observatory and Radio transient Detector (CHORD)
Project Description: CHORD will be a breakthrough radio telescope composed of a close-packed core array with two outrigger stations, offering unprecedented observational capabilities. CHORD will transform  studies of cosmology and the transient radio sky, and offer rich partnerships opportunities for Ontario companies.
Keyword: radio astronomy, fundamental physics, cosmology, radio telescopes, algorithms, software development

Project Title: A Massive Transformation of the Dragonfly Telephoto Array
Project Description: We will transform the Dragonfly Telephoto Array, using Made-In-Ontario components, to enable it to map out the distribution of dark matter and gas in the local Universe to unprecedented accuracy. This will maintain our (and Ontario’s) global leadership in key areas of technology and astrophysics.
Keyword: Galaxies, Dark matter, Optics, Telescopes, Imaging

Project Title: Multi-Material Additive Manufacturing
Project Description: This project addresses the immediate need for innovative R&D in Canadian additive manufacturing, based on three focal schemes: (1) new materials; (2) new technologies; and, (3) new applications and products. These schemes are reinforced using machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Keyword: Additive Manufacturing, Artificial Intelligence, High-Entropy Alloys, Aerosol Deposition, Light-weighting

Project Title: AcDC: Accelerator for Donnelly Collaboration
Project Description: We will establish the Accelerator for Donnelly Research (AcDC), an environment that will promote interactions between biotech sector partners and scientists in the Donnelly Centre at the University of Toronto.  We aim to enable projects that will accelerate personalized medicine.
Keyword: precision medicine, genome editing, genetic networks, antibody engineering, antibody therapeutics, chemical genomics

Project Title: Mega-Scale Multi-Dimensional Experimental Facility for Enhancing Canada'sInfrastructure Resilience
Project Description: The project will establish a laboratory that will enable a new level of accuracy in large-scale multi-dimensional civil infrastructure testing and modeling. The resulting research will ultimately enhance the safety, economy and resilience of Ontario’s critical civil infrastructure.
Keyword: Resilient Cities, Resilient Infrastructure, Large-Scale Testing, Earthquake Engineering, Hybrid Simulations

Project Title: Waterloo Aquatic Threats Environmental Research (WATER) Facility
Project Description: This project will develop a state-of-the-art aquatic facility to support cutting-edge research in aquatic health carried out by a team of leading experts in the fields of evolution and aquatic ecology, vertebrate host-pathogen-environment interactions, physiology, toxicology and microbiology.
Keyword: Fish biology, amphibian biology, environment, immunology, toxicology, epigenetic, conservation, ecology, invasive species

Project Title: CCAT-prime: A Submillimetre Wavelength Survey Telescope in Chile
Project Description: Ontario scientists will join an international team to build CCAT-prime, a telescope of revolutionary design, located in northern Chile, to enable scientists to advance knowledge in areas of fundamental physics including the nature of Dark Energy and Dark Matter, and the effects of gravitational-wave
Keyword: Astrophysics, Fundamental Physics, Advanced Instrumentation, Software, Robotics, Machine Learning

Project Title: Developing Innovative Technologies for Predicting and Remediating Environmental Contamination
Project Description: This proposal will address the challenges associated with environmental contamination from mining, industrial, and municipal wastes. Investment in cutting-edge infrastructure will allow us to develop world-class field facilities and enhanced laboratory techniques to expand our collaborative studies.
Keyword: water, geochemistry, mining, environment, sustainability, remediation, landfills, municipal wastewater, toxicology, bioremediation

Project Title: Advanced Materials Ontario: Harnessing the power of multifunctional materials for new technologies
Project Description: Advanced Materials Ontario provides a unique, multidisciplinary materials research facility for foundational research to deliver robust, multifunctional materials for targeted applications, transforming the development of commercialization-ready biosensors, advanced catalysts, and solar cells.
Keyword: Chemical sensing, biomedical and health monitoring devices, environmental remediation, bitumen up-cycling, solar cells, hydrogen fuel cells, renewable energy

Project Title: forWater AID: Advanced Infrastructure Development for forested drinking water source protection technologies in Canada
Project Description: ForWater AID enables 1) cutting edge facilities to analyze known and emerging threats to drinking water treatability and 2) world class watershed research observatories to identify threats to Canadian water supplies and develop forest management-based technologies to ensure drinking water security.
Keyword: drinking water treatment, source water protection, forest management, water quality, hydrology, watershed science, pathogens, algae, cyanotoxins, fine sediment

Project Title: Women's Virtual Care Research Laboratory
Project Description: The Women’s Virtual Care Research Laboratory will catalyze world-leading research on novel digital technology solutions that address critical health system gaps in Ontario, including the mental health of vulnerable populations, hallway medicine, aging, and coordination of primary and specialty care.
Keyword: Virtual care, Mental Health, Surgery, Aging, Primary care, Women’s health

Project Title: Technology-Enhanced drug Development and manufacturing (TEnDev): MirrorLab
Project Description: Building on a $12M industry-academic partnership between York University, leading analytical platform makers and pharmaceutical companies in Ontario, the TEnDev initiative will advance new technologies that enable accelerated, low-cost development and precision manufacturing of (bio)pharmaceuticals.
Keyword: Mass Spectrometry, Drug Development, Drug Manufacturing, Drug Design, Protein Dynamics, High Throughput Characterization, Mass Cytometry, Nuclear Magnetic Resonance, Bioanalytical

Project Title: Tabletop probe of PeV-scale new physics
Project Description: Ultraprecise measurements will test whether the electron has a small distortion in its charge distribution, in a quest to answer one of the most fundamental questions in physics. The infrastructure pushes the limits of current technology and ensures Ontario’s leadership in fundamental science.
Keyword:
polar molecules, tabletop high-energy physics, rare-gas matrix, laser spectroscopy, precision measurements,
cryogenic coolers, lasers, vacuum, electric dipole moment

Project Title: Examining the Adoption and Use of Emerging Privacy Preserving Technologies:  From Blockchain to Differential Privacy
Project Description: This research examines the capability of emerging privacy-preserving digital technologies such as blockchains and differential privacy tools to address users' concerns about privacy and ownership of personal information, and the effectiveness of these technologies to work for the benefit of Canadians.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: System and Devices for Cardiovascular Interventions
Project Description: Dr. Tavallaei will build on his previous achievements in developing new and improved tools and devices to address deficiencies in minimally invasive cardiovascular interventions, thus improving outcomes and costs for direct health benefits to Ontario while helping the Ontario medical device industry prosper.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: Active Learning Research Labs
Project Description: Educational technology scholar James Slotta will build a world-class suite of three spaces, collectively called “The Active Learning Labs”, to support the research of how teacher candidates develop active learning pedagogies to support Ontario youth in developing critical 21st-century competencies.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: Infrastructure for the characterization of proteins and their modifications in health and diseases
Project Description: The requested mass spectrometer will allow several new types of proteomics experiments and analyses to fully characterize proteins in health and diseases and these will lead to new diagnostics and protein-targeted therapeutics that will benefit all Canadians in terms of health, quality of life, and the economy.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: Biskaabiiyang and Indigenous Political Resurgence
Project Description: This proposal aims to create a mobile qualitative research lab with multimedia technologies to support Dr. Damien Lee’s CRC research program which focuses on increasing understanding of inherent Indigenous political systems, how they survive and thrive in practice, and their social media impacts.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: Research for Social Change Lab
Project Description: The Research for Social Change Lab will allow PI-Nichols and her collaborators to 1. archive, manage, protect, community-generated dated; 2. create, implement and test useable open-data infrastructure for these and other data stored in and managed by the Lab; and 3. enable people to navigate and effectively use Ontario’s emerging open-data landscape to better monitor and address community concerns. Research activities will focus specifically on addressing the effects and root causes of homelessness and poverty.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: 3D AOD RAMP multiphotonic microscope system for ultrafast detection of neuronal signals
Project Description: Dr Katalin Tóth’s research program aims to identify the process by which the brain creates, stores and retrieves memories. Understanding these complex processes is essential for the development of effective treatments strategies for deliberating memory deficits occurring in dementia and Alzheimer’s disease.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: AI-Backed Internet of Vehicles Laboratory: An Open Access Innovation Facility
Project Description: The project will bridge an open access research facility with the autonomous vehicles cluster so to improve connected and autonomous vehicle technologies for Ontarians while offering the benefits of operationalization of the data analytics-backed vehicular sensing services to the municipalities.
Keyword: NA

Project Title: Distributed Performance and Sensorial Immersion Lab V2.0
Project Description: This project delivers much needed infrastructure to the Distributed Performance and Sensorial Immersion Lab. It will enable the creation of artificial intelligence, virtual acoustics and bio-feedback methods that will enhance, explain and transform creative expression in the performing arts.
Keyword: NA

Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Preclinical Magnetic Resonance Imaging for Targeted Brain Tumour Therapies
Project Description: Drs. Gang Zheng, Lothar Lilge and Gelareh Zadeh are proposing projects to develop new treatments for primary brain tumours. Magnetic resonance imaging will be central to developing, administering and guiding these treatments.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Optimizing metabolic health with methyl nutrients and their role in one-carbon and trimethylamine-N-oxide metabolism
Project Description: The proposed research program will use an emerging approach called precision nutrition that takes into account metabolic complexity between people. Overall, this research may help optimize dietary recommendations based on the origin of individual variations to reduce metabolic disease risk.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: The development and application of genomic tools to modernize risk assessment and protect human health
Project Description: This research program will harness genomic technologies to modernize human health risk assessment of environmental chemical exposures. Long-term goals address the need for increased testing efficiencies, reductions in animal use, and improved protection of human health.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Inclusion, Interaction, and Intervention: The Triple-I Lab
Project Description: This proposal seeks to establish a state-of-the-art behavioural research lab. The lab will accelerate and support innovative interdisciplinary research focused on understanding the interpersonal dynamics of social inclusion. The knowledge gained will promote the creation of a more socially inclusive Ontario.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Intelligent Verification and Adaptation of Critical IoT Systems (VERACITY)
Project Description: In order to ensure that critical IoT systems are trustworthy and capable of meeting their quality-of-service requirements, this unique research program is requesting software and hardware to enable the simulation, verification and adaptation of large and complex Internet-of-Things (IoT) systems.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Intracranial Hemorrhage Center of Excellence
Project Description: We propose a first in Canada intracranial hemorrhage (ICH) center of excellence, focused on multidisciplinary translational research, cutting-edge therapy, education and skills dissemination. Our goal is to lead innovation in all aspects of ICH, a devastating disease with no effective cure.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Kinetics-transport interaction towards deposition of carbon particulates in meso-channel supercritical fuel flows
Project Description: Understanding turbulence-transport-chemistry interaction during coke formation and deposition in supercritical fuel flows at aircraft engine conditions. Experiments include optical diagnostic of coke build-up, in situ fuel composition and velocity measurements, and ex situ study of coke particle structure.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: A study of induced seismicity through novel triaxial experiments and data analysis methodologies
Project Description: The extraction of hydrocarbon and mineral resources results in induced seismicity posing safety risks to workers and negative societal and environmental impacts. Fundamental research will be carried out to better understand the key processes that lead to induced seismicity to help better mitigate its risks.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Neuronal mechanisms of dynamic emotional behavior
Project Description: This project investigates how the brain stores traumatic memories and the neuronal mechanisms that produce emotional responses when these memories are recalled. Exploration of neuronal circuits of emotional behaviour will create a path toward therapeutic developments for mental health disorders.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: The Evolutionary Genomics of Infectious Phytopathogen Emergence
Project Description: Emerging plant diseases impose a substantial burden on Ontario’s agricultural industry and cause major food deficits in developing nations. The goal of this research is to uncover how infectious diseases emerge through diversification of disease-causing genes that allow them to subvert plant immunity.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Towards the sustainable development of energy resources - Fundamentals & implications of hydraulic fracturing technology
Project Description: The objective of the research program is to advance the fundamental understanding of rock behaviour when subjected to hydraulic fracturing technology. The research will inform the natural resources industry of the prevailing mechanisms to address technical, economic, social, and environmental challenges.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Combination ribonucleic acid treatment technology lab
Project Description: Diseases like arthritis and incurable viral infections require several parallel treatments because they are caused by multiple malfunctioning biological processes. This program uses a suite of advanced equipment to build smarter drugs that automatically coordinate different treatments simultaneously.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Integrated non-invasive human neuroimaging and neuromodulation platform
Project Description: Dr. Lin’s research will advance existing neuroimaging techniques, such as MRI, to improve diagnostics and treatment of brain disorders via less invasive procedures and more effective treatment, particularly for neuroscience studies and clinical applications in neurology and psychiatry.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Constraining source compositions and timescales of mass transport usingfemtosecond LA-MC-ICPMS
Project Description: The projects will explore the inner workings of volcanoes, petro-tectonic carbon sinks and sources, and exploration of mineral resources. Through in-situ isotopic analyses of natural and experimental samples, we will illuminate the evolution of our planet’s lithosphere, hydrosphere, and atmosphere.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: The Advanced Membranes (AM) Laboratory for Sustainable Water Management and Resource Recovery
Project Description: The Advanced Membranes Lab will develop membrane technologies for the sustainable management of water and metals. Research will include fundamental transport studies and synthesis of high-performance membranes. Work will benefit the mining, pulp & paper, and water engineering sectors.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: The Microbiome Engineering Laboratory for Resource Recovery
Project Description: This research will 1) create novel anaerobic biotechnologies that recover valuable bioproducts from organic wastes, and 2) develop systems & synthetic biology approaches for engineering microbial communities. Resulting biotechnologies will contribute to building a circular bioeconomy in Ontario.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Chair Indigenous Waters, Climate and Sustainability
Project Description: The proposed research aims to understand the nexus of water justice, climate-action, and governance for Indigenous Peoples by developing best practices, assessment tools, and sustainability indicators to increase Indigenous Peoples’ participation and leadership in international sustainable development.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Infrastructure for advanced hemodynamics research
Project Description: The research team will use the latest ultrasound technology to improve knowledge about blood flow, and the impact of physical activity on blood vessel health. New ultrasound techniques will inform key prevention and diagnostic discoveries to improve the health of inactive adults in Ontario.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Infrastructure for Advancing Vision-Based Structural Assessment Technologies
Project Description: This proposal is to acquire advanced research infrastructure to support research in novel and automated vision-based inspection methods which can accurately measure damage in deteriorating civil structures, and assessment procedures that employ such measurements to enable more reliable assessments of in-service civil structures.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Infrastructure for Clean Energy Research: Innovative Studies on Novel Catalysts for Small-Molecule Fixation
Project Description: The requested infrastructure will allow the team to bridge the traditional limits of synthetic inorganic and materials chemistry, with an overarching goal to develop new functional molecules that promote the equitable use of resources and to generate new materials that can be employed for applications in energy/sustainability science.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Mobile Weather Microphysics System
Project Description: The CRC in Adaptive Aerodynamics will develop a novel Mobile Weather Microphysics System to understand the impact of weather stressors on autonomous vehicles (AVs). The CRC research program will accelerate AV development, implementation and improve AV safety in regions with harsh weather.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Trustworthy Artificial Intelligence Lab
Project Description: The Trustworthy AI Lab at Ontario Tech supports the research program of Canada Research Chair Dr. Peter Lewis in developing AI with reflective capabilities, leading to a new generation of trustworthy, socially-sensitive machines, with an awareness of themselves and their relationships with others.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: NMR Instrumentation for High Resolution Protein Structures, High Throughput Drug Screening & Metabolomics
Project Description: The requested instrumentation will enable atomic level structures of disease-causing proteins to be determined and establish high-throughput screening of molecules in patient samples. This research has the potential to develop new therapeutics and personalized medicine capabilities to benefit all Ontarians.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: CerebroVascular-NeuroMetabolic Interactions in Humans
Project Description: We aim to gain new insight into mechanisms of small vessel disease in the aging brain. The new infrastructure will enable critical studies of microcirculatory function and neural metabolic changes in the brain and how damage at this level relates to heart and large artery dysfunction outside the brain.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Gene Therapy Development for Musculoskeletal Diseases
Project Description: This proposal will identify disease-modifying gene therapy strategies targeting inflammation and regenerative pathways to treat post-traumatic and genetic forms of osteoarthritis (OA). In addition, we will examine the role of tendon and ligament pathologies in the progression of OA.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Surviving Memory in Postwar El Salvador: A Collaborative Research Initiative
Project Description: Surviving Memory in Postwar El Salvador is an international partnership committed to documenting the history of the Salvadoran Civil War and preventing future violence. The requested infrastructure will support documentation of wartime massacres and stories of Salvadoran migration to Canada.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Mapping Stories Global Research Lab
Project Description: his application requests infrastructure to establish a hybrid mobile/stationary lab that aims to collect data from arginalized populations who have experienced extreme adversity--such as poverty, war, and climate change--in order to share their stories using creative research dissemination leading to positive changes in  policy and practice.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Speciation analyses for elucidating molecular mechanisms of environmentalselenium chemistry and toxicology
Project Description: Selenium (Se) is an important contaminant released from some natural resource processing operations in Canada. In our research, we will develop and test analytical methods for monitoring Se and its different chemical forms in environmental  samples from Se-impacted ecosystems, because current methods are  inadequate for those purposes.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: The Climate-Data-Driven Design (CD3) Facility for Built Infrastructure
Project Description: This proposal outlines the equipment necessary to establish a novel, and unique to Ontario, outdoor laboratory at York University that will focus on developing more climate-resilient infrastructure systems through the development of advanced sensing techniques and application of AI-based data analytics.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Establishment of the Intelligent Visualization Laboratory
Project Description: This application is for funds to develop the Intelligent Visualization Lab at York University, Toronto, Ontario. The research from this lab will significantly improve the ability of professionals ranging from data scientists to business analysts, to healthcare analysts, in analyzing data and making decisions.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Infrastructure for the Catalytic Synthesis of Medicinally Relevant Organofluorine Compounds
Project Description: The proposed project will develop efficient, cost-effective, and greener methods for the synthesis of medicinally relevant fluorine-containing compounds, which can be applied as new classes of pharmaceuticals and medical imaging agents.
Keyword: N\A

Project Title: Niagara College NextGen Greenhouse Excellence
Project Description: Niagara College looks to expand upon strategic infrastructure to serve the growing Ontario greenhouse technology sector, particularly in biologic, climatic and urban technology applied research streams. The infrastructure will be housed in a new greenhouse where partners can evaluate emerging trends
Keyword: Greenhouse technology, cannabis biocontrols, growth trials, product development, integrated pest management

Project Title: Lambton Water Centre
Project Description: Through this ORF request, Lambton College will expand its laboratory capacity for water research to increase its ability to support local, provincial and Canada wide water start-ups, SMEs and large industry to develop, improve, optimize or enhance their water related technologies and methodologies.
Keyword: Water, wastewater, Water Chemisty, Culturing, Piloting Treatment Systems, Treatment Technologies

Project Title: Cambrian College
Project Description: Through the Battery Electric Vehicle Lab (BEVL), Cambrian College hopes to facilitate battery electric vehicle adoption in the mining industry by providing industry partners with access to research infrastructure to make more informed decisions when it comes to swapping out diesel technologies.
Keyword: Battery electric vehicles, power train testing, battery emulation, underground equipment
